name: PLOS Author Contributions
tagline: Text-mining and analyzing author contributions in PLOS articles
body:
This was the result of a [Hack4ac](http://hack4ac.com/) team on 6th July 2013 working to mine and analyse article data from the [PLOS Search API](http://api.plos.org/) and PeerJ for detailed author contributions.

Several aspects were developed simultaneously:

* A [PeerJ](https://peerj.com/) integration to pull author contribution information;
* A PLOS API bridge that queries the PLOS API, enriches it with author contribution information and converts it to CSV on the fly;
* A purely [R](http://www.r-project.org/)-based implementation of mining PLOS for author contributions and a subsequent statistical analysis. This project is described in more detailed [here](plos_author_contributions.md).

### PLOS API Bridge

The PLOS API bridge can be found under `plos-api` and is written in [Ruby](http://www.ruby-lang.org/) with [Sinatra](http://www.sinatrarb.com/). To run it, ensure you set a `PLOS_API_KEY` environment variable like so:

```shell
$ export PLOS_API_KEY=decafbad
```

Then you can run the web application with [Thin](http://code.macournoyer.com/thin/) (as it streams responses):

```shell
$ bundle install
$ bundle exec thin start
```

### Datasets

Prepared datasets can be found under the `data` directory and are all in CSV format.
